OUR VISION

To provide opprotunities for the material and intellectual growth of all our employees, and through our joint efforts, contribute to the advancement of society and humankind.

We work every day to uphold the following tenets :" The customer is our first priority, the employee is our second and the shareholder third." From this core value we are guided by six principal values that are fundamental to our corporate culture and an integral componemt of our DAN.

Stronger, More Sustainable, & More Affordable

Light

Light gauge steel frames, joists and trusses are made from 'C' section profiles usually ranging from 0.75-0.95mm and are much lighter than timber.

Fast

Steel framing is much quicker to manufacture and assemble as they stay square during transportation, yielding a quick and easy installation.

Strong

Steel frames are also very strong and durable, meaning they can be used for a wide variety of applications, both internally and externally.

Steel has been used in building and construction work for around three-quarters of a century; and the many benefits it offers leads to its popularity with construction projects, either commercial or residential.

Why choose light gauage steel:

1. Steel is very durable; unlike wood framing it doesn't warp or expand. It can withstand Level 9 earthquakes and hurricane wind speeds because it is flexible and can bend without cracking (plasticity).

2. Steel copes better with water damage than wood, because it doesn't rot – how good its moisture resistance depends on its carbon content.
Hot zinc coating and extra powder treatments for enhanced rust resistance will make a structural steel component even more immune to the effects of water.

3. Steel is highly resistant to fungus. Woodworm and termites aren't an issue.

4. Steel frame panels are grounded directly to earth - they are therefore
highly efficient lightning rods for dissipating lightning bolts into the ground.

5. Steel isn't combustible which might mean a discount on buildings insurance. Components can be quickly ready-made off-site then transported to wherever they're needed.
They can be made in any shape and clad with any type of material and they can be joined together via bolting, welding or riveting. The frames can be rapidly assembled on site (with the right skills and tools).

During the construction phase of a project, steel frames save time and money in a number of areas:

  • ✔ No cutting, welding or heavy lifting required
  • ✔ No weather delays - steel does not absorb moisture
  • ✔ Accuracy of build means windows, doors and bathrooms fit first time
  • ✔ Only basic tools required to erect on-site - fast construction
